documentId: Understanding Arguments_ An Introduction to Informal Logic (1)
content:
This  in-
cludes spontaneous abortions or miscarriages, but these raise no moral
problems because they are not the result of human action. Furthermore,
the moral problem of abortion arises only when the death of the fetus is an
expected  consequence  of  terminating  the  pregnancy.  To  focus  on  these
problematic cases, from now on we will take “abortion” to mean the inten-
tional termination of a pregnancy with the expected consequence that the
fetus dies as a result.
